Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Trav11
Reviews.Content: Being Wyndham members we've stayed here before. The one-bedroom apartment we stayed in this time for five nights is a far better option than the tiny studio apartment we were in the time before, which is really a hotel room with small kitchenette in part of the room. The one-bed is quite spacious with comfortable living/kitchen area separate from the bedroom and bathroom. As others have mentioned, there's a supermarket just a few minutes' walk away in a small shopping mall and Central Station is five minutes away if coming from the airport by train or departing for the Blue Mts as we were, at the end of our Sydney stay. We didn't notice any noise at all during our stay which was surprising as our apartment was on the corner of two busy streets. The bed was very comfortable as was the lounge sofa and chair. There were a lack of microwave utensils - just one chipped casserole dish which I could have cut my hand on easily but which was quickly replaced when I reported it. I did mention the utensil problem on my form when leaving so we'll see if this is remedied next time. There is some pressure for a sales presentation each time when we arrive. This time, we actually slept in and didn't make it but didn't mind as we are quite happy with the level we are on with the timeshare program. We are quite happy to stay there in the future if we take the one-bedroom apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Sydney base”
Reviews.Author: JoJoVanuatu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Wyndham several times in the last few months. As a regular visitor I have stayed at many Sydney apartment properties and Hotels, this one stands out as my favorite several reasons. 1. Excellent location - its location seems to be very handy to anywhere I want to go. 2.The apartments are very clean, well presented and well equipped. 3. All of the staff I met, and the Manager were extremely helpful, friendly, courteous and make you feel very welcome. I was there recently when Sydney was experiencing a deluge of torrential rain, and the staff were actually on the street to hail a cab for me! The facilities are excellent, but the service exceptional, obviously a very well run property!!

Reviews.Title: “Try the Wyndham - a terrific apartment hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Brisbane_traveller11
Reviews.Content: I go to Sydney fairly regularly, working in the CBD in King Street, and my first choice of hotel is the Wyndham. I really like it because (a) it is very reasonably priced for the Sydney CBD (b) the rooms are terrific, being like an apartment with separate bedroom and lounge, small kitchen, ability to open windows, nice bathroom (c) it is an easy walk to Chinatown, Darling Harbour, and World Square Shopping Centre with heaps of great shops and a big supermarket (d) it has nice staff, a gym and a tour desk and (e) it is an easy and pleasant walk across Hyde Park to other parts of the CBD. For after hours there are some cute pubs close by, heaps of taxis and cinemas in George Street. I really like it for business, but it would also be great for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Ren95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham for 3 nights at the end of March. We found the staff helpfull and accomodating and the hotel itself well presented. There is no foyer or sitting area as such but it is more targeted at being a long stay or vacation style establishment. The rooms were modern and self contained with all the amenties you would expect, however the rooms are quite small. There was alot of stuff packed into our 1 Bedroom queen room that we had to rearrange some of the furniture to make way for our bags. Once we were settled and made some space though it was fine. The bathroom was an okay size and clean. The balcony is really just a large window, there is no real space to stand outside and we really only stuck our heads out for a look anyway. I have an issue with paying extra for parking and this hotel didn't miss us charging us $30 a night for parking, however this seemed to be about the top end of average for Sydney CBD. It is quite a long walk to the harbour from this hotel but there is an abundance of shopping, food and grocery stores to be found around the hotel. There is a lovely park quite close also. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again - however I may try to strike a deal with the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment accomodation in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: Harrietah
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in early March. We arrived at about one p.m. and were able to check in straight away which was much appreciated. The apartment was a one bedroom and was surprisingly spacious. The lounge area (where the sofa bed was located) was on the street side and a little noisy, however, the bedroom was at the back and fairly quiet. We didn't hear any noise from adjoining apartments. The staff were very helpful, even lending us large umbrellas when there was a downpour (there was 41/2 ""/10cm rain in one day)! Since we were staying for a few days, one facility we found useful was the laundry, there is one on each floor and ours never seemed to be busy. There is also a small gym on the second floor and a cafe onsite for light meals. Wifi is available although it is not free. There is an Indian restauarant around the corner with free wifi (and great meals) however. Overall we found it a very comfortable accomodation option, I don't think you would be able to find apartment accomodation of this standard, at this price, elsewhere in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “CLOSE TO EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: 1valerie
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 4 friends and my husband on March 12th - March 15th. (3 nights). The staff was great----kind, friendly and most helpful with directions. The room was perfect for our short stay as we did use the plates, utensils and glasses. The 2 bedroom suite (room 1602) had a scale, blowdryer and all the emenities one would need. The only complaint was the sofa bed - one of the most uncomfortable beds. It was wuite old and definately needed to be changed out for a new one since this one sunk clearly down the middle. We did not mention it to the staff for we were only there for 3 nights...but if we stayed longer, it would be a problem for us. This hotel is only 2 stops away from CIRCULAR QUAY - (Opera house, Ferries, the Rocks, etc.) Museum subway stop was a block up and easy to catch throughout the day. All in all, the hotel is great and it helped that all the staff were very nice and accomodating. I would stay there again, for sure. ***Ask the front desk how to get to MACCHIATO cafe - it's only a short walk (5 minutes), and they serve the BEST CAPPUCCINO'S!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham on 10 Feb for 1 night only. We had emailled that we would arriving early and when we got to reception at 10am we were told we were on the priority list. We came back after 3 hours to be told the room still not ready. We went away again returning at 1pm. We were once again told our room was not ready so we waited in the lobby. 40 minutes later our room was ready. I don't consider 1.45pm an early check-in when regular check-in time in 2pm. However, our room was fantastic with a separate bedroom. The kitchenette was a nice surprise. The staff were very friendly and I loved the little restaurant suggestions sheet that they handed out. Great location and we would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: E F
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for four nights. We had a large one bedroom apartment, nicely decorated and very comfortable. Enough facilities in the kitchenette to make dinner. Everything was kept nice and clean. A small but perfectly formed gym. Close enough to Museum Station to walk with luggage. We walked everywhere from the hotel, it's in a great location. Would stay again if we make it back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family!”
Reviews.Author: offto
Reviews.Content: What a great place for a Sydney visit; beautiful, amazing price for what you get, and a perfect location if you are going to be hopping on the train! It is a very modern cute one bedroom apartment just a short walk from the Central train station, 2 blocks from a grocery store, and around a 25 minute walk down to the Sydney Harbor. The kitchen is amazingly stocked (we made breakfast each morning before heading out for the day), very clean, safe, quiet (we were on the 10th floor) and the staff helpful, friendly, and professional. We walked to the Sydney Harbor via two beautiful parks, enjoyed the botanical gardens, the harbor, and then did the Sydney Bridge climb before walking back to the hotel. A lot of walking but we liked the distance because it gave us a chance to see more of the city. Because we had to catch a train to another city early a.m. our hotel was perfect; you can check out, walk 10 minutes, get on the train for your next adventure. A perfect stay at the Wyndham Vacation Resortt Asia Pacific; we would definitely stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and nice place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ondama
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on a couple of occasions and are always pleased with our room, this time we had a 1 bedroom suite which included kitchen and dining facilities. The staff are very helpdful. The hotel is situated close to Central, Museum and Town Hall stations. The only annoyance was that on this occasion a wake up alarm went off on the room phone at 6am, presumably set by previous guests - not needed on a Saturday morning. We had midday check out which was convenient. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Very clean. Great service. Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Luco92
Reviews.Content: Overall very happy with hotel! We stayed for 5 nights in February 2012 and have nothing to complain about! It was just what we wanted. After booking the accommodation through a cheap wotif deal we scored a one bedroom studio. Each day we came back to fresh linen and more kitchen supplies (sugar,tea, coffee) and half way through the stay clean sheets for the bed. At NO extra charge. The rooms were very clean with full kitchen and a plasma tv (lounge and bedroom). As for the bed... The BEST! Very comfy. Great night sleep with blackout curtains. We certainly loved it here. Great friendly staff who assisted us when needed. They held our bags for us on our last day too :) Location was good as near museum station... But a bit far to walk for anything central to the CBD. Free city shuttle bus located nearby though. Close to china town too :)Some street noise(sirens) as we were on the 2 nd floor but after a busy day in Sydney we didnt wake to it. Overall very happy. Great value for money... I would recommend it to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay but watch out for the 10am check out”
Reviews.Author: Tyce
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we were attending a party nearby and did not want to drive home that evening. The hotel itself was okay. The lobby was very small but rooms were relatively spacious and clean. The room also had a little kitchen which could come in handy for longer stays. The thing that annoyed us was the 10am check out time. When we booked online, the booking site said check out was 11am. In the room itself, there was some information about the property which said check out was midday. However, when we returned to our room late in the evening we received a note saying that check out was 10am! This is the earliest check out time I've ever seen and we would not have chosen this property if we had known this in advance. We called reception to ask for a late check out but were told no and the receptionist was very unhelpful and just kept stating, like a machine, "check out is 10am, these are our rules". However, upon our request, the manager did call us back and was very polite and offered us a later check out due to the mistake on the booking site. This is a large hotel and they should be able to manage the flow of rooms to at least allow a 11am check out. The manager said 10am was normal practice in Australia but this was not our experience at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Sydney. Good family Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Liz-MelbAust
Reviews.Content: The 1 bedroom apartments are a good size for a family and well equiped. The sofa beds are a little uncomfortable though. Easy location to get around Sydney, Chinatown and Darling Harbor. Close to World Square. There are lots of dining options. The free tourist bus is very close and an easy way to get down to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Greg B
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be a perfect location to explore Sydney as good transport links nearby and only a 10 minute walk from Darling Harbour. A tiny reception that looked more like a Youth Hostel and the beige and grey corridors with big metal doors reminded my husband and I of "prisoner in cell block H" but once in the rooms they were fine. Experienced a few problems with the lifts breaking down during the stay and it was a bit hit and miss whether the lift accepted your room card to activate it. Other than that the staff were very friendly and helpful. Wi fi was available in the room at a cost BUT THEY OFFER free Wi Fi in the cafe downstairs it is just not well advertised in the hote rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay - excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Iantravelsalot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there over the Christmas and New Year period. We booked the serviced apartment earlier in the year as reasonably priced accommodation is difficult to find for the holiday period, especially if you leave it late to make a booking. The apartment is situated about two minutes stroll from the southern end of Hyde Park. We had previously decided to walk or use public transport for the duration of our stay. Having a car in the heart of Sydney is more of a hindrance than a help unless you absolutely need one. We used to walk to most places - the heart of the CBD is a 10 minute stroll, Darling Harbour about 15 minutes and Circular Quay (CQ) takes 20 minutes. There is a free bus service (555) which runs a circular route between the main rail station and CQ. It stops fairly close to the apartment as do buses to Bondi. If you are staying about a week or more then I suggest you purchase a MyWeekly pass for $41 as it covers all travel on the city rail network, the municipal ferry service and all buses for the southeast quadrant of Sydney. This includes buses to Watson Bay and Bondi Beach and ferries to Manley. A Coles supermarket is less than 5 minutes stroll away as are restaurants. Our trip into Sydney was by hire car but fortunately there is a couple of free 10 minute parking bays very close to the entrance. Check-in was quick allowing us to take our cases to the room, get back to the car within the allotted time and hence, return it to the rental company a few kilometres away. Our one-bedroom apartment was on a high floor (as requested when booking) and overlooked the road junction outside the entrance. The room had a patio door which opened onto a very small balcony. It was possible to stand outside but that was all! The main room had a sofa (which could be made up into a second bed), a table & 3 chairs, coffee table and a fully equipped kitchenette. The bedroom had a king size bed, wardrobe with a safe + drawer unit. The beside tables also had drawers. The ensuite had a walk-in shower but no bath. My wife and I prefer a shower so the lack of a bath was not an issue. The shower head was on a flexible hose which makes balancing water pressure/temperature so much easier than showers with fixed heads. A range of toiletries was provided. The building has three separate laundry rooms for guests and they are well utilised. On the ground floor the building is linked to the cafe next door for breakfasts, etc. We did not use it during our stay though not for any reason other than we wanted to have breakfast in our room. The air-conditioning in the apartment had two zones - one in the main living area and one in the bedroom. They could be set independently of each other. The system was very quiet but effective. The apartment was serviced every day including Christmas Day. Everything in the apartment worked well. Last but certainly not least; we met and spoke to a lot of staff during our stay. Without exception every one of them was very helpful, cheerful and courteous even when I am certain they wished they were celebrating the Christmas holidays with their own families/friends. They were superb. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: moreinput
Reviews.Content: We had two nights here and were very impressed with the room and service. Our car was valet parked and when required it was waiting out the front on time. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable and even though the room faced the street and we were on the first floor there was no apparent street noise. The kitchenette was very useful and we enjoyed the space of the suite. We could easily walk to the train, Chinatown, the shops and Darling Harbour. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Handy place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: 70sGrrrl
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here before departing on a cruise. We had a one-bedroom unit which was clean and well-equipped with linen and kitchen gear. We were on the 2nd floor but there was little street noise. I liked the location which was near transport, restaurants and pubs. We didn't eat in the cafe or use any tourist services so I can't comment on that. Front desk staff were helpful when we needed directions or taxis. On check in you may be offered a free breakfast. The property is part of a timeshare network so expect a sales pitch. We are already owners but sometimes go along to catch up, get the breakfast, free bottle of pretty good wine and a $25 shopping voucher. If you're interested by all means go, it's not a hard sell and it may suit you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RussellBrisbane428
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the Wyndham mid week and was very happy with the property. I was originally booked into a studio at $155, but on getting up to the room realised that i had been been allocated a modern, clean, well furnished one bedroom apartment which was great, two seperate small balconies, seperate bedroom, lounge suite to relax on, study desk, dining table and chairs, 2 tvs, dvd player, microwave, cutlery, cookwear, etc. All this for $155......bargain! The location for me was very good, i intentionally booked this hotel for its position and really couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: emmylou302
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in one of the small apartments there as it offered a kitchen with utensils included so we could choose to eat in and save the pennies if need be! The apartment was lovely and clean with a comfy bed and large shower. Towels and linen were provided for us so we didn't need to bring anything with us - which was a huge space saver for our suitcases (it actually meant there was just a lot more room for all the shopping I did!!). Staff there were really friendly and there was always someone around to help, no matter what time of day or night it was. It's worth noting that they participate in an airport shuttle which collects guests every half hour during set times of the day. This was about $1 cheaper than the train but I was advised this run could take up to an hour as the bus stops at other hotels along the way. Museum station is the closest and right on one of the central lines to either the airport or Circular Quay, and Central station is about a 10 minute walk in the other direction and operates the same as above but also services Bondi, Cronulla and the North shores. There is a cafe attached to the hotel / apartments but there are also some great places to eat along the streets either side of the Wyndham. Although it was a longish walk from the harbour at times (only due to jet lag and the rain!) it was a great base to explore the city from and the best way to see it really is on foot. Would be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: barry1943
Reviews.Content: A smaller comfortable Hotel in a very handy position in Sydney. Rooms are smallish but extremely well equipped. Very clean and staff are extremely pleasant and helpful. Close to shops, reataurants, buses inc the free shuttle bus to city and Circular Quay. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Desertdiva24
Reviews.Content: First off, I will say my recommendation for this hotel may be a bit biased because we stayed in a Presidential Suite; however, I'm sure the other rooms are just as great. The rooms were clean, modern, and had all amenities. They were also quiet, as I couldn't hear the guests next door or the street noise below. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. They helped us make phone calls and get around the town. The gym is nothing to brag about. It's the size of a walk-in closet with a treadmill, bike, elliptical machine, and a small universal. It's in a great location. Train is easily accessible, as well as the busses, parks, and Circular Quay is a 30 min walk away. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: amberjerry
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. The staff was excellent and very helpful. The room was average. I'm glad we had a short stay in Sydney, because it was like being in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bell10_63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham for 4 nights in a 1 bedroom apartment and have left thoroughly impressed with the place. I would recommend this accomodation, the rooms are very clean, very well appointed and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The staff were very helpful. The price was very reasonable. I was a bit apprehensive befor going as some of the previous reviews were not that favourable, we did not experience that at all. I would stay here again and would recommend to others also.

Reviews.Title: “More like a tired building hosted by rude staff”
Reviews.Author: DenTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: For the price I thought we found a great deal in Sydney but.... Here is the truth of this hotel. The rooms are not ready at the promised time which I can take with a grain of salt. Once we got our room we walked into a room that smelled of smoke and body odor. We requested another room and thought we were set. Our new room didn't smell as bad but not pleasant either. Then the fun started... We could hear nearly every spoken word in the rooms surrounding us even into the late of the night. The next morning we tried to take a shower and to our amazement there was a half glass wall with no way to contain the water. Then soap began to come through the floor drain! The bed was not comfortable either. I brought the issues to the attention of the staff and they were extremely rude and questioned everything but said they would see what they could do. Well they did nothing and I asked the manager about it on check out and all she provided were excuses and said if I had a concern to contact Wyndham directly. Well I will do just that. Do NOT be tempted by the price as it isn't worth the hassles of a poorly kept property or rude staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BrunswickAustralia
Reviews.Content: I will be checking out of the Wyndham and have been very impressed. The main thing to focus on is the rooms (you won't get extras like a business centre etc as these are apartments). In a nutshell my apartment has been excellent. The room was clearly recently renovated, was well maintained and very spacious. The kitchen was a good size and functional (i.e. you can actually cook in it), the lounge room was surprisingly spacious, the bedroom was as well and the bathroom too. I enjoyed my stay and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Surpasses all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Thtrebuf1
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed here and we just can't stop raving about this hotel. From the very start, we found the front desk staff to be the most helpful and accommodating staff that we have ever interacted with in all of our timeshare stays. They went above and beyond, were willing to help us book tours, gave wonderful recommendations for places to eat and made our stay perfect. They were quick to respond to requests and were always very positive. The hotel is located close to the free bus stop which will take you down to circular quay. Darling harbor is within walking distance. There is no free wireless but there is a mcdonalds close-by which offers free wifi. I would strongly recommend this condo/hotel to anyone heading to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the hard sell”
Reviews.Author: 7DC
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and I came back because of the location and size of the rooms. The reception staff Nicole was very accommodating and found a room for me straight away even though it was only 10am when I arrived. The room was clean and spacious and great value for money. It's like having a one bedroom apartment with a proper kitchen for the price of an average hotel room elsewhere. The one unpleasant thing this time was a note left under the door when I went out. It said "Please come down to reception to collect your welcome pack". This welcome pack is just a ploy to get you downstairs to speak to a vacation ownership rep. He tried to give me two mini snickers when I told him I wasn't interested in the vacation ownership presentation. For those familiar with these presentations, it's a marketing gimmick to get you to part with $20K to get access to vacation ownership. Apart from the above, the rest of my stay was without any issues and the check out was swift and efficient. I will likely return in the future but I won't bother about the 'welcome pack'.

Reviews.Title: “A home in the City”
Reviews.Author: AussieJB62
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroomed Presidential suite which had a deck with a spa ...and we used it in the middle of July (Aussie winter) after a long day shopping! We actually live in Sydney - about 20kms out of the actual centre and decided to get to know our own town a little more. The accommodation was very high quality - well equipped kitchen (we ate in two out of three nights). The beds were very comfortable and the apartment was very quiet at night. it is a 5 minute walk to Chinatown, a 2 minute walk to the free city loop bus, and about 10 minutes walk to the fabulous new Westfield shopping mall (and food court extraordinaire!) It is a few minutes walk from the Capitol Theatre where we enjoyed Mary Poppins

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shaz90
Reviews.Content: we arrive at 7.30pm and check in was on spot without any wait.Nice and friendly staff .Really appreciate the accomodation side as we had two bed room apartment with full kitchen facility with all utencils clean and sparkling.Overall the rooms were spacious/ clean as well as well maintained. Handy location to train station and other shops and market. would love to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: sall13h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and had a studio room. The room was really nice, quite compact for Sydney hotels but definitely big enough for us. It was beautifully appointed and had a small kitchen which has a microwave, sink, kettle and I think perhaps a stove, though I can't recall. The people were really nice too. We'd definitely stay here again, it is in a pretty good location, especially if you want to see something at the Capital Theatre. We walked to Darling Harbour and Circular Quay so it is doable, though a bit of a walk which is not such a problem in Sydney as it is always nice and lots to see.

Reviews.Title: “Will go at any time.”
Reviews.Author: bokka23
Reviews.Content: Out second time staying there...very handy and close to public transport, china town, paddy's market and any other transprt....friendly staff and clean acommodation. A very short walk to all shopping and the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: remadrid17
Reviews.Content: Visited Sydney, Australia with family and extended family. It was our first trip to Sydney and we wanted to make sure we got great value for the money we paid. We all know Sydney is crazy expensive so the last thing we wanted to do is waste money on a sub-par hotel/vacation rental. I came across the Wyndham Vacation resort and was very happy with the apartment hotel. We got there very early in the morning (8am) and found out only one of our apartments were ready - that wasn't a problem because we at least had a place to drop off our luggage and freshen up a bit. The other room which was next to ours wouldn't be ready until 2pm which was fine with us. We got a *STANDARD* 1 bedroom apartment that included a kitchen area with fully stocked pots and pans and a living room area that could easily sit 9 people. The living area was big enough to where you had space to walk around if you had put luggage all over the place like we did. It also had a flat screen t.v. that was mounted on the wall. I will say that the range of channels weren't that great. You get about 10 channels. At first we were disappointed but realized we were going to be touring all day and only coming back to rest for the next day. We found some stained spots on the carpet but I've seen that at other hotels and it didn't bother us - they might've just needed to do some steam cleaning. The bedroom was a very comfortable king size bed with fluffy pillows and for some reason after touring Sydney I refused to lay down in the bed because as soon as I did I'd be falling asleep. Very comfy bed. The bathroom was well stocked if you forgot anything (which we didn't). We did have to go back every day to get a fresh set of towels which was a hassle. We received excellent service from the staff for recommendations on dining to best routes to take to the city. They happily answered our 4 million questions and provided us extra information on what the "locals do". Much appreciated as always. We had to leave early on one morning to take a flight to Wellington, NZ and they were very happy to arrange a cab for us at 5:00 in the morning. The location was big plus. We were in fact in the CBD district but were closer to Elizabeth street and a few blocks from Hyde Park. We were near the hustle and bustle which we enjoyed but due to the hotels location we could escape to the quieter areas. We had no problem with noise as we were on the 7th floor but we also were walking all day and were dead tired so I guess that plays a factor as well. The metro station is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. If you like taking cabs expect to pay no more than $10 from Darling Harbor to the Hotel or from Circular Quay to the hotel. Overall we had a great stay and would recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone and will return.”
Reviews.Author: Craig-Melbourne
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to find this accom. for 2 nights at very short notice after checking out from my planned accom within 5 mins of checkin. The staff were great from my initial call through to checkin (10 mins later!!) I stayed in room 703 and it was very clean and comfortable, plasma tv's in both lounge and bedroom with good selection of foxtel channels. The room also had cooking facilities which was a surprise, as similar sydney venues rarely do, even when you consciously look. Would recommend to anyone and will return.

Reviews.Title: “A secret gem”
Reviews.Author: dougaloz
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. You get a one bedroom suite at the rate you'd normally pay for a simple Hotel room. It was very clean, modern, well furnished (nice comfy King bed), lots of fluffy towels and blankets and the basic kitchen provides all you'd need. The suites aren't huge but ours was more than adequate ... in fact, if it was a bit bigger I'd move in. the hotel is well positioned in the CBD & we'd happily recommend this Hotel to anyone. The only oddity is that the staff will only allow you to checkin at "exactly" 2pm? Strange but minor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flyguy05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my few days in Sydney, arrived from Cairns. We were met at check-in with friendly staff and after being helped up to the room, we were told if we wanted to receive a $100AUD voucher. The catch was that I was to go to a meeting or something about a timeshare, I without a doubt said "NOPE" and the gentleman asked if I was sure and I just reaffirmed my response and all was good. We stayed here because I have a friend that has a timeshare so I think the room we got was pretty modern and the furniture wasn't the best but still comfortable. Stayed at a 2bedroom apartment with a kitchenette (not many utensils nor pots and pans to use but still very helpful to cook). I did have problems with the sofabed, as it didn't want to come out and i didn't want to use force and break it and have to pay for damages so the concierge came up and used some force to fix the sofabed. Well about the location, its close to the Museum train station and there is a Coles near by the World Square Market, so getting around to places is not an issue here. Aside from this I mean yes, I do recommend the Wyndham to others out there.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again for sure.”
Reviews.Author: JayPhi
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay in Feb 2011. One bed apartment. Bedroom a little on the small side but not as small as some. Very good to excellent cleanliness, though most furniture showing some age related wear. For value for money and location, this place is hard to beat in Sydney. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: gmccoy
Reviews.Content: Since we were staying 3 weeks, they gave us a larger suite with the bedroom in the back for increased quiet, which was terrific. Staff were excellent and helpful. The coffee shop next door is an attractive enhancement to this place. Close to World Market, a mall with a food market, was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: Galloise
Reviews.Content: The studio apartment we stayed in was very nice and clean, with plenty of towels provided but we found the overall service very impersonal (although one might expect that from apartment style accommodation). Location was also good and we walked pretty much everywhere. Breakfast was provided in the cafe, the staff there were extremely friendly and we could order whatever we liked from the menu. However...of all the hotels I have ever stayed in, I have never before had a "friendly reminder" note pushed under the door at 10pm on our last night, reminding us to vacate by 10am the next morning and ensure the room is clean! (Not mentioning that all literature in the hotel room states that check-out is at 12pm). A very blunt reminder that your holiday is well and truely over!! It certainly doesn't make you feel like a valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Love the staff, building needs a bit of improvement”
Reviews.Author: kmakani
Reviews.Content: Our family, including my parents, stayed here for a week. The staff were amazing, and it is located central to everything there is to see in Sydney. Loved that. The first night, we needed to stay in another unit, which was one of the upper floor studios. Small but comfortable, newer decor, nice size bath and kitchen for a studio. Water was nice and hot, newer furniture. They didn't have a pull out couch, just 2 chairs, so luckily, my parents had a 1 bedroom so the kids could sleep on their pull out couch. The next room was a bit different. These are the ones for the timeshares from RCI and so on. The furniture was older and faded, but not bad. The water didn't get hot. You had to turn on the shower 30-45 minutes before it got hot enough to take a shower, the TV would lose color, where you would need to turn off the power from the back, wait 10 seconds and then turn on for color again, the DVD player would feel like it was dying when it would slow down to the point of stopping (tough when have 2 children watching in the evening). The water was the toughest thing to deal with. We are a go with the flow type family so we stayed, but I could see a more picky family not deal with these issues. On the positive side, the staff were great, central location to the grocery store, transportation, and sites to see. If you don't mind an old building, cold water, and old electronics, not a big deal. For the price and location, I can deal with those things I guess, but would research for other places with kitchens.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, very well located, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Swansforever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights in this resort. We enjoyed our stay and had forgotten what it is like to stay in a small apartment as opposed to a hotel room. Having a small kitchen enabled us to make our own breakfasts (although $7.50 cereals and coffee or toast and coffee breakfasts are available downstairs in the adjoining cafe). It was also a benefit that the door between the bedroom and the living area could be closed and this prevented any light/noise from entering the bedroom. The rooms are clean, well-appointed with good linen and plenty of towels. There were 2 widescreen tvs, both with Foxtel. The kitchen had a microwave, 2-plate stovetop, jug, toaster, small fridge and basic crockery and cutlery. The room was fairly quiet, considering it is located on the edge of a major city - it was definitely no noisier than anywhere else in the city. The location is fantastic - you can walk to anywhere, including trams, buses, shops, many tourist attractions etc. The only small criticism I have is that the bed was a double and it wasn't perfectly flat. But overall, we felt the resort was fantastic value and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “we'd go there again”
Reviews.Author: lemmon90
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights in a studio apartment. Excellent position-right in centre of CBD-very busy roads, but little traffic noise. 1 block from free bus to Circular Quay, 3 blocks to supermarket and monorail.Very good staff-we arrived at 7am and they let us into our room! Hotel facilities good, breakfast(free for us)- in bakery on ground floor, available 6.30 onwards, room serviced daily. 3 laundries in the hotel. Our room had fridge, hob, microwave and a handy safe..The hotel was within walking distance of Central Station (cost $15 from airport), but we booked a shuttle bus for return trip ($12 straight to airport) Definately to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good service.”
Reviews.Author: WindsurfAZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about a week, and the location/price combination was superb. Property is about 2 blocks south of Hyde Park, a few blocks east of Chinatown, and a few blocks north of the Central railway station. PRO: * Location * Price * Friendliness & helpfulness of staff * Overall cleanliness CON: * Lower-level rooms can get quite a bit of street noise from city traffic, especially on weekday mornings. * A single, local phone call of about 20 minutes in duration cost us roughly 60 Australian dollars. Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING SERVICE BY SOME RECEPTION STAFF AND GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Unofficialbusiness
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a man of Oriental descent. We didnt understand the need for a credit card imprint, however the Oriental man was very good at explaining that it was needed for incidental charges. We were then given a welcome pack! The contents of this cannot be disclosed... Another young receptionist looked overworked - he was of a Middle Eastern appearance with sideburns and even though he was inundated with paperwork, he still managed to make us feel at home. It wasn't just us who felt at ease - the Oriental man looked in his element as the Middle Eastern man was making life easier for him! I wish I had a stressful job and still gave the impression that I was on holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lucem
Reviews.Content: The staff were great, especially when we thought we might have to stay longer than originally booked because of the European volcano problem. They offered a very good special rate for delayed fliers. Luckily we did not need to use it. Walking distance to Darling Harbour, Paddy's Market, Circular Quay, Australia Museum, etc. A branch of Coles was nearby, much cheaper than the on-site shop which, strangely, did not mark prices on any of the goods on display.

Reviews.Title: “above average, wheelchair accessible”
Reviews.Author: chanmarshall
Reviews.Content: my partner is in a wheelchair so we often find it difficult to tell which hotels will be suitable by purely booking online. after a small hickup (they sent us to a normal room first, after lugging all our bags up to the room we quickly realised my partners chair couldnt even fit into the bathroom) we were soon settled in a wheelchair accessible room with an adequate bathroom and large easy to access shower for him. the valet parking was normally fairly quick, most of the staff were good, some were quite slow and seemed disinterested but it was nothing major, although the lobby is very small so once you have 3 people with luggage down there you can barely move but again just a small pain. the rooms were nice, location is good, being originally from sydney i think it probably has the most convenient location for us as it is central to everything, close enough to the train stations, only a short stroll into george st, oxford st etc. we stayed for 3 nights and overall it was a good stay, better than a lot of the other hotels in sydney we have stayed in, especially in regards to the wheelchair aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Big, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: TravelinLeather
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 days in Jan 2010 as my friends and I went on a vacation and wanted to ring in the new year in Sydney. The hotel is located near Hyde Park (which is just a block north of the hotel) and near Central Station (which is just a few blocks south/west of the hotel). I booked a studio but ended up with a 1-bedroom. Everything in this hotel looks newly remodeled. The kitchenette was very clean and everything up to date. It didn't even looked used. We went out for all meals so i didn't use it, but it was nice to have a mini-fridge for storing drinks. Three floors have laundry facilities - one washer and dryer which did come in handy for a quick load of some laundry for extended stays and even though they weren't free it was around $2 for each. As with all hotels in Sydney, internet is outrageously expensive. My experience is that if your hotel even has internet capability you are lucky. This hotel has internet available in each room. As of Jan 2010, the price is $12.95 an hour, or $99.95 a week and at least it was reliable.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER I stay we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: retiredteacher0
Reviews.Content: IDEALLY located. the staff is extraordinarily helpful. CLEANEST room we have ever stayed in and EVERYTHING one could need (FULLY equipped kitchen). modern room furnishings (flat screen TV's) . WISH we had found this resort long ago, will FOR SURE return next summer.!!! The hotel made our vactaion enjoyable. If we never left the room it would have been enjoyable, the room was THAT nice!! Proves you get what you pay for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is great. Room is skimpy.”
Reviews.Author: Paycationist
Reviews.Content: Location is easy walk to Chinatown for food and nightlife (walked here on a Friday night or its because it is close to the Entertainment Canter). Chinatown is also a place to catch the monorail if you want to explore the Darling Harbour. Monorail stops at 9 stations. It's also 2-3 blocks walk to catch the city free shuttle that operates from 9am-3pm, that's a free ride to Circular Quay where you can catch ferries and meal cruises to different destinations. Bathroom was sparking clean. Bed is comfortable. Room is generally clean. Here are my gripes though from major to minor: - I upgraded to sky suite and expected a view. Disappointed to see buildings of office windows. I just read about traffic noise in the view side of the building, so I can let this one go. - Internet is expensive and SLOW. I paid for 24.99 AUD for 24 hours. It will cost u a bit less if you opt for a longer use, i.e., $100+ for a week. It is not Wi-Fi, but Ethernet cable. It could have been worth it, if the internet speed is fast at least, I won't mind the pay. -Desk staff customer service is average. They seem to be so focused on their paperwork and computer in front of them at the desk. You initiate the friendly smile and greeting (all the time... as far as my stay). Nothing superb. -The room is very skimpy. Total floor area (bedroom, bathroom, lounge, kitchenette) equals the total area of hotels like Marriott. So please don't expect an average size space. There were no decent space for our luggage and I have to walk sideways at 2 sides of the king bed (always wonder how hard work it is for the housekeepers in perfecting the bed and room). -no bathtub, but bathroom is very spacious. Despite it all, I will come back and book here, but not sure if I would recommend. I might. From a Vacation Club Owner

Reviews.Title: “If you're a member of Worldmark/Wyndham take care how you book...”
Reviews.Author: Rushie02
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Wyndham before and found it OK. I booked Bonus time two nights next week, thinking that as we are members of Wyndham, we would get a better rate than anything available to the general public. The bonus rate is $294 for two nights. I can get the same room on an internet booking site for $290.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: LabTested
Reviews.Content: We love this place, and have stayed more than once. Its great that it is an apartment, not just a sydney hotel room, at a good price. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment and had a lovely sitting/TV room with kitchen faciltities. It is close to Sydney's sights. You can walk or catch the local train to anywhere. The walk to Central Station is only 5 to 10 minutes with bags if you arrive by train. As described the check in facilities are small, and parking undercover is extra. Our room was immaculate, recently renovated and very clean.The bed is really comfortable. The staff are helpful and eager to help. Though at night there is only one staff member on and no there is no room service at any time. A cafe downstairs and a 7/11 place deal with the essentials. There is a highly rated Thai restaurant "Spice I Am" less than a block away, so you can eat in or take out. China Town is a short walk away, so you will never starve. Some places there open till 3am. We have stayed before and will come again. Such a convenient location, helpful staff and great facilities. It so much more than a hotel room. Love the space.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: oceanmatt
Reviews.Content: I know Sydney well and was travelling through Australia for work, I decided to stay on after I had finished my job and so wanted somewhere central. I booked this property through wotif.com for a price of aroun AUD$140 per night. Like I say, I know Sydney well, so I wasn't too bothered about doing the touristy tsuff as I have seen it all before, more important to me was being close to the nightlife and shopping in Sydney. When I arrived at the Wydnham, the property was more centrally located than even I had figured from the map. 3 minutes walk to the nightlife of Oxford Street, the same distance to Museum station, 5 minutes walk to Central station and about five minutes to the shopping of Pitt and George Street. I think you would find it hard to get a better location in Sydney. Location wise, it is directly opposite the Travelodge and next door to the Vibe Hotel. You are on a very busy intersection, although I never had an issue with traffic noise, Saturday and Sunday night you could hear police sirens through to the early hours. The apartment itself was a decent size, probably around 300sqft, maybe a little bigger. Decorated in very modern "Ikea-stle" contemporary furnishings. The room is a lot smaller than it looks in the pictures, I think the pictures that they use on wotif.com and also the Wyndham website are of a 2 bedroom apartment. The one bed apartment is supposed to be suitable for 4 people, but I would not want to be in there with that many people. There was VERY limited storage in the apartment, the closet is of a weird shape so that half of it you cannot have anything hanging up in. There was a great little nook by the doorway to store your luggage in. The bathroom is AMAZING. Shower only, no bath, but nicely decorated, the mirror doesn't steam up when you shower. It is small, but perfectly formed! The kitchenette is suitable for making basics, kettle, toaster, two ring stove, microwave oven... Wired internet access is available in the room, no wifi in the property. As with most Sydney hotels though, it is VERY expensive, I think it was $22 per day or $100 for a week. On three floors in the hotel there are laundry facilities. $3 for a wash and $2 for a dry. Nice, high capacity machines. You can only access hotel floors by swiping your room card, also late at night reception access is via card swipe also. There is a tour desk in the reception if you do need to book excursions. In the same building is a small bistro that I didn't use, but offered breakfast and lunch. There is also a convenience store, selling the basics at highly inflated prices, but ideal if you just need to grab something and go... there are also internet terminals in there if you want to quickly check your email. For better shopping, three blocks away is the World Square development with a large Coles supermarket. The only complaint I had about the apartment is that the sofa bed in the lounge was broken, you couldn't sit on it as a sofa, you would fall onto the floor, but I was in the apartment alone, so it wasn't too much of an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Surprisingly Good Location”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastguy71
Reviews.Content: When I saw this hotel on a map, it looked like I'd have to do a fair bit of walking to go anywhere. When I got there I discovered that Museum Station is only a block north and the cinema district in George St is a short stroll (about 3 blocks). The reception desk are very friendly and helpful. The room itself was a bit small, but the bed is big and soft. Tip: Avoid the convenience store below the hotel (not affiliated with the hotel). As with most convenience stores, it is a bit pricey... ok if you are only getting 1 or 2 items. Head west along Goulburn St and you will get to a supermarket at World Square. Use this to do any serious grocery shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great interiors”
Reviews.Author: Bolstergrove
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham is quite understated from the outside as one approaches the reception area,But once inside your room one is lifted by the standard of the interiors,all very clean,tidy and sumptuouse,everything is at hand one would want for a lengthy stay,We could'nt fault the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, usually my preference in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CherryPuppy
Reviews.Content: Great location in Sydney, on the edge of Chinatown. Museum train station is a couple of minutes walk. Darling Harbour is 5-7 minutes down the road. City centre is 7 minutes walk. Glebe (Broadway Mall) is 15 minutes walk. Hyde Park is 5 minutes away. This used to be called Trendwest Sydney and Southern Cross Suites before its current name. Limited eating options at the hotel with a cafe on-site, but you are in Sydney, so eating options abound! A nice Indian restaurant (Jaipur) is just around the corner down Foy Lane, barely a minutes walk. Within 5 minutes you have everything from kebabs to Thai to Greek to Chinese to an assortment of fast food, and more. Vibe Hotel next door has a nice bar, and there are several pubs in the immediate area. There is a convenience store around the corner as well. Hotel rooms are nice, particularly suited to those who are not fussed about eating at the same hotel. Rooms start with studio apartments and progress to multiple bedrooms, so great if you are travelling with family or friends. The bedroom type units have full cooking facilities. The establishment is sort of membership-based, so you need to buy "credits" in their programme (Worldmark) to stay, but you can also pay for a room instead of using credits. However, I have seen the hotel available on some Internet sites, so I am guessing they are perhaps bending the rules sometimes. This is often my choice of residence in Sydney due to its location, and the size of the rooms, and amenities/facilities. Do note that check-in time is usually 4pm, and check-out is 12noon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean..a Little GEM”
Reviews.Author: woo742
Reviews.Content: Obviously tthis place has had a revamp within the last year....cause we found it a little GEM !! Our room was called a studio deluxe.....it was very small but comfy.... good spot, staff were great...ill be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Graet little timeshare aparthotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexCarlisle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Apart/Hotel once before when it was the Southern Cross Towers. Since then, Wyndham have taken it over and spent 2 years refurbishing. It has just been completed and now offers totally modern and stylish accommodation. Stayed in a one bedroom suite, with a fully equipped kitchenette, large bedroom with king bed and a separate lounge/dining area. Flat screen TVs in bedroom and lounge, and a DVD player in the lounge. A spacious bathroom with large walk-in shower (no bath). Desk internet & safe, laundry facilities on 3 floors. Overall, a very pleasureable stay after moving from a very cramped, much more expensive room in the Rydges just 2 blocks away. Situated next to Chinatown and near Darling Harbour and Hyde Park. Wished we'd found this sooner and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK!”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: This place is just away from the main action around Darling Harbour. You cannot see it, but you can walk there quiclky enough. Important things: Bed was comfortable, hot water plentiful, size of room bigger than I was expecting. It is not a spacious apartment, but it is bigger than the average hotel room, with a couch to sit on. My room was quiet, important to me. Reception area is small, not hotel-like, but serviced-apartment like. Not really an area to sit around. Reception itself was fine, helped me with getting around and tourist assistance. No breakfast! I think they can get you something delivered, I went along the road to another hotel for breakfast. You will not remember this place years after your visit, but it does not let you down either.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Revenue15
Reviews.Content: Central hotel close to Oxford Street. One bed apartment very large, clean, good value. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to get around Sydney with small children”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel for us was with a 4 year old and a 2.5 year old in tow it was just a 10 minute walk (at their speed, probably 5 minutes for adults) from the museum underground stop that took us directly down to circular Quay(2 stops) and the ferries. The airport train also goes to this stop making it easily accessable from the airport, even with loads of bags. We had a 2 bed-apartment, which unlike the previous review we found the living area quite small, particularly with 2 young children. As people have said it is quite worn and the ensuite shower in the main bedroom tended to flood the bathroom so the corner of the bedroom carpet smelt quite musty. The cooking facilities are quite basic, just a couple of rings and a microwave, but good enough for what we used it for. On the plus side we were on the 15th floor, so although there wasn't much of a view, we were above the level of the surrounding buildings so it didn't feel to closed in. The rooms were very quiet, other than the sound of the odd emergency vehicle we didn't get any noise at all, and also clean. As another reviewer mentionned, the convenience store right next door to the hotel is extremely expensive, 8AUS$ just for a loaf of bread and a bottle of water so I would avoid using this if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “BIt shabby, good for Darling Harbour & Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We actually got an upgrade to a 2 bedroom apartment but would agree with many of the comments some new linen and towels would have been a nicer treat! The rooms are spacious and the showeroom ensuite had a great shower. The views were awful but we had come to see Sydney and not to look out of the window! Staff were friendly and attentive and we managed to extend our check out by an hour so that was helpful. This is not a glamourous hotel, so don't expect any frills as you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Really close in and clean!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If the price is right, which is was for us, this is just a good solid place to stay for a small family. If you want a view and all the frills, stay somplace else, but if your interested in doing downtown and the harbour.......this does the trick. We stayed 4 nights and were able to walk to most of what we wanted to see. Two blocks away you got a good internet cafe. I would say it was pretty close to staying at a clean Holiday Inn but not up to a good Marriott or Hilton Inn level.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here the rooms where very clean and reasonably equipt. The decor was ok we expected a slum and got a very good hotel, The beds were comfy the shower and hairdrier and complimentry toiletrys were goog, the staff were great. Coles supermarket is down the street under the sony center and carry on another 200 yards and its china town. The hotel is a block down from oxford/ liverpool st. and at the bottom edge of the city center there is two pubs accross the road and a shop attached the breakfast in the cafe is a little steep so go and find it else were.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You have to walk to all transportation from this hotel. Our room was really small. We had a "studio". the "kitchenette" was smaller than my closet at home. We were on the 12th floor and had to go to the 15th floor to get ice. The walls are pretty thin so we were able to hear our neighbors. A big plus is that the staff if very helpful

Reviews.Title: “They didnt mind the mess I made”
Reviews.Author: Kane57
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week on the tail-end of our holiday around asia and australia, and we enjoyted ourselves greatly! We stayed on the 13th floor and had a nice view of a office over the road, and the room was very nice, we were accustomed to hostels and were surprised to find a clean, modern looking room with a lovely bathroom and a deep bath! We thought the breakfast was sufficient and fuelled us for a days walking, and as far as room service, we just ordered pizza from Domino's.....they had the pizza with us in 15 mins!!!!!! (Good service). There was a great cheap bottle shop nearby, and not an eyebrow was raised every morning when the staff came to clear out the VB bottles we left.........the only real complaint we had was regarding the fire alarm, which conveniently went off at 7am on the first two days of our stay, evacuating in my spongebob squarepants pj's is not cool (im 22, should know better)....all in all i would definately stay again, and will recommend the hotel to my friends and my enemies.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use your frying pan!”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebar23
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week in August 2003. I had a small room with a kitchenette. The staff we friendly, helpful and understanding even though I managed to get the whole hotel evacuated through trying to fry a T bone steak. My smoke alarm went off, due to the cooking. Why supply a frying pan in the room if you can't use it? The staff were very understanding ... so were the lovely Sydney Fire Fighters; all of which had to visit my room. I am so sorry if you were subjected to this situation!! VERY EMBARRESSING. This hotel is centrally located, handy for local restaurants and is short walk to the main railway station. Room was at times fairly noisy but apart from that had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Only managed one night”
Reviews.Author: r40jfm
Reviews.Content: The rooms were sub standard and the staff didn't care, so we only lasted one night. We had pre-booked this hotel through a reputable holiday company in the UK, even so we checked out and found somewhere else for 3 other nights. The place wasn't dirty, it was just delapidated, even the corridor pictures were missing and there were cigarette burns on the bed side furniture. Places like this should be closedown, until they can offer the travelling public a decent nights rest in return for their money. I managed to get a refund back in the UK, but still felt ripped off. The second hotel was fine, which is something I expected in a very pleasant major world city.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but Shopworn”
Reviews.Author: yank
Reviews.Content: We and two of our adult children stayed five nights in a two bedroom unit during February, 2005. The unit was very spacious and reasonably clean, but in dire need of renovation. The wallpaper was peeling and some of the walls needed minor repairs. The carpet showed wear. The price was reasonable for downtown Sydney, but I'd be willing to pay a bit more for a unit that wasn't quite so shopworn.

Reviews.Title: “not luxurious but decent”
Reviews.Author: melbguy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in January 2005. The lobby is tiny and not particularly impressive, and the corridors look like they need a facelift but the rooms are actually not bad. We had a decent-size studio with a kitchenette and a bathroom and I also saw a one-bedroom suite, which was quite large. No, there's no cable TV and only four coat hangers in the closet, but location makes up for a lot: it's an easy 30 min walk to the Sydney Opera House and 5 minutes to George St or Oxford St shopping and entertainment. Give the very basic breakfast buffet a miss and go to one of the many coffee places in the vicinity. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. This is a good place for those who are not looking for luxury but want decent accommodation at an acceptable price.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Cross Suites is a No Frills Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family spent 8 nights in this hotel in September, 2003. We were disappointed in its quality. It is not a bad hotel, but is very average. The lobby is very small and plain for a hotel in a large city. Our travel agent told us there was an on-site restaurant, bar and room service. There is no bar. The restaurant is a very small cafe with a limited menu, counter service only and which closes in the afternoon. The morning breakfast buffet there never varied in its limited selection and was quite bland. When I hit the room service button on my room phone, I got the front desk. I was told I needed to find the pamphlet in the hotel information booklet and call one of the 2 delivery services advertised there. The delivery service company will go to a set list of area restaurants then deliver food to your room. It requires an outside phone call, and as far as I can tell neither are affiliated with the hotel. Claiming this is room service is a bit of a stretch. Any local hostel can also give guests these pamphlets. The furnishings in our room were also drab and seemed worn. The hallways could use fresh carpet and wall paper as well, as these are also clearly worn with age. There is no swimming pool. There is a pool service available for a fee, which is less than a 10 minute walk. However, if you are trying to entertain children during a rain storm, leaving the hotel to go swimming is not ideal. The staff was friendly and courteous though. And check in and check out was efficient. My complaint is that I feel they claim to be much more "luxurious" than they are. There are also several nearby "adult" themed bookstores and bars, which can be awkward to walk pass when you bring your children. I definitely do not recommend this hotel for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about 8 days in June, 2003. This is not a bad hotel. It is very average and your basic chain hotel. It is in a fairly quiet and safe location, about 5 minutes walk up a hill to Oxford Street. It has no restuarant but it is connected to a cafe. The staff were friendly and helpful. I had to change my room twice due to other guests being rude and noisy. I was put in a larger room with windows that open.

HotelInfo.Name: Wyndham Vacation Resorts Asia Pacific Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 34-35 Cnr Wentworth Ave & Goulburn St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
